settings.heading: Why Utrogestan?
settings.description: Utrogestan is a body-identical progesterone used as part of menopausal hormone therapy for women with an intact uterus.

settings.title: Body-Identical
settings.description: Chemically identical to your body's own progesterone

settings.title: Well Tolerated
settings.description: Designed to work naturally with your body

settings.title: Market Leader
settings.description: The trusted choice in New Zealand

settings.icon_svg: <svg width="28" height="28" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M9 12l2 2 4-4m6 2a9 9 0 11-18 0 9 9 0 0118 0z"/></svg>

settings.info_text: Utrogestan contains progesterone, which is body-identical to the progesterone naturally produced by the ovaries. It's used in combination with estrogen therapy to protect the lining of the uterus in women who haven't had a hysterectomy.
settings.disclaimer_text: UtrogestanÂ® (progesterone) is a prescription medicine used as part of menopausal hormone therapy in women with an intact uterus. Always read the label and use as directed. If symptoms persist, see your healthcare professional. TAPS Approval No: [To be added]
